p: In single option total consumption tests, no significant differences ( p > 0.058) were observed in the consumption values of MSG or sucrose solutions between pigs born from control or MSG-fed sows ( Table 5). Pigs born from MSG-fed sows showed a tendency to a lower MSG intake than did animals born from control sows at 1 mM ( p = 0.058) and 3 mM ( p = 0.062).
